subject: Learning
title: Goal Setting for Learning
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Goal Setting for Learning.

hook.text: 'I'll study biology tonight' is a wish. 'I'll answer 20 flashcards on cell division by 8pm' is a goal.

buildup.text: Effective learning starts with specific, measurable goalsâ€”not vague intentions.

discovery.text: Goals work by directing attention, sustaining effort, and providing a benchmark for self-evaluation.

twist.text: Performance goals (get an A) can increase anxiety. Learning goals (master cell division) sustain motivation.

climax.text: Breaking a big goal into session-level subgoals creates momentum and a sense of progress.

punchline.text: A goal without a plan is a wish. A plan without a session is a dream.

quiz.question: Why are learning goals better than performance goals for sustained motivation?
options: They focus on mastery rather than grades, reducing anxiety
Performance goals always lead to better outcomes
Learning goals require no effort to achieve
